review: This solves one problem but creates another.  It solves the problem of waiting to access Netflix on our projector via our old Windows 7 laptop that takes forever to boot up and frequently cuts in to push system upgrades or other annoyances.  With the Chromecast, streaming begins in a few seconds and continues (so far) without interruption.  Ahhh!  But this cheap little gadget is provoking an expensive overhaul of our audio system.  It streams Netflix audio (for most films) in the new Dolby Digital Plus (DD+) format.  Few AV receivers and fewer sound bars can handle this format, which means that our existing system will downgrade the audio to stereo only.  The 5.1 home theatre surround sound setup won't work.  So, to take full advantage of the Chromecast, we need a new AV receiver that reads DD+ and we need to replace the sound bar with a separate speaker system.
